title: An injury scare had a Providence goalie in net for the Bruins on Thursday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Michael DiPietro, a Providence Bruins goalie, replaced Joonas Korpisalo after a collision in Boston's 4-2 win over Columbus.
DiPietro played for 6:03, stopping two shots, before Korpisalo returned to complete the game for the Bruins.
Korpisalo saved 36 of 38 shots, while DiPietro has a .938 save percentage in the AHL this season with Providence.

title: N.H. woman arrested for alleged murder of her baby following 11-month investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hepay Juma, 26, from Manchester, N.H., charged with reckless second-degree murder of her infant found in Pine Island Pond.
Infant known as 'Baby Jane Doe' was discovered dead in Manchester, N.H., on March 27, 2025.
The case involved about 50 leads and an increased reward, with active investigation ongoing, authorities stated.

title: Way overdue on checking a car’s transmission fluid
author: John Paul
bullets: A reader's 2006 Mazda3 had black transmission fluid; garage drained it twice and recommends a flush in 10,000 miles.
A 2019 Subaru Crosstrek owner faces $1,600 of dealership repairs, including TPMS sensor replacements and cracked control arm bushings.
AAA Car Doctor advises periodic antifreeze checks for a 2018 GMC Denali, as evaporation may occur in closed systems.

title: South Shore school evacuated after snow causes ‘structural stress’ on roof
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Plymouth River School in Hingham evacuated due to roof's 'structural stress' from heavy snow accumulation.
Students and staff were relocated to Hingham High School, where they received lunch and transportation home.
Hingham experienced over 17 inches of snow during Monday's blizzard, leading to the evacuation for safety.

title: David Ortiz changes his tune on Rafael Devers after previous criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Ortiz criticized Rafael Devers for his defense and conditioning leading to trade to Giants in June 2025.
Ortiz, despite past criticism, expressed love and respect for Devers in a recent podcast, emphasizing growth and support.
Devers' trade was influenced by position refusal after Red Sox injury problems and signing of Alex Bregman.

title: Gas leak identified as cause of Taunton explosion that displaced 8 residents
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A natural gas leak caused an explosion in Taunton, destroying a three-family home and injuring two residents.
A 25-year-old woman and her 2-year-old daughter were seriously injured and hospitalized after the explosion.
Community fundraisers have gathered over $33,000 for the injured family and thousands more for other affected residents.

title: Patriots reportedly remain a bottom-10 team in new NFLPA report card
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rank 26th out of 32 in the 2026 NFLPA report card, an improvement from 31st in 2025.
Team's facilities and travel resources criticized; new facilities expected to improve future rankings.
Patriots' team ownership received a B- grade, indicating progress but still in the bottom 10 overall.

title: Malden teacher, basketball coach arraigned amid allegations he raped high school foster child
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Scott Marino, 54, a Malden teacher and coach, was arraigned for allegedly raping an 18-year-old high school student.
The student was in Marino’s foster care and a basketball player on the team he coached at Malden High School.
Marino was released on $75,000 bail under GPS monitoring, with orders not to contact the victim or leave Massachusetts.

title: State Police sergeant charged with assaulting driver during traffic stop
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Sergeant Joel Daoust charged with assaulting a driver during a traffic stop in Springfield last month, prosecutors said.
Daoust faces charges of assault and battery, and assault with a dangerous weapon involving pepper spray use.
Daoust, suspended without pay, has previous disciplinary actions from 2015 and 2017, according to State Police records.

title: Readers push back on ChatGPT use in Massachusetts executive branch
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Governor Maura Healey announces adoption of ChatGPT in Massachusetts' executive branch, prompting public backlash.
65% of surveyed Massachusetts readers oppose the use of AI assistant, citing privacy and environmental concerns.
Healey highlights AI's potential to boost government efficiency, offers free Google AI training to state residents.
